Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw one land habitat and one water habitat, such as a forest or playground and a pond or stream.
The student can illustrate a variety of plants and animals in each habitat, such as trees, bushes, grasses, and squirrels in the land habitat, as well as fish and clams in the water habitat.
The student can effectively compare the two habitats by showing at least two different types of living things in each.
The student can observe and depict patterns, demonstrating the varied plant and animal life in each habitat.
The student can demonstrate understanding by basing their drawings on observations from nature walks or reliable media resources.
CANNOT: While the student mostly avoids inaccuracies, they might occasionally miss labeling a particular plant or animal, or label something less clearly due to oversight or rushed work.
There is a chance the student might sometimes leave out a minor detail, such as a specific invertebrate in the depicted water habitat, or misplace it by error during a creative endeavor.
